edu.nd.darts.cimon
Class CpuUtilService

java.lang.Object
  edu.nd.darts.cimon.MetricService<Long>
      edu.nd.darts.cimon.CpuUtilService
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObservableUpdate
public final class CpuUtilService
extends MetricService<Long>

Monitoring service for CPU utilization. CPU utilization is measured as cumulative sum of jiffies by the underlying linux system, where 1 jiffy is commonly about 10 milliseconds (sometimes 1 millisecond). Utilization rates can be determined by comparing the difference in count of jiffies for a particular action/state and a particular time frame versus the total number of jiffies over that same time frame.

CPU utilization metrics:

  • Total : total jiffies measured (used for comparison to determine ratios)
  • User : time spent in user mode
  • Nice : time spent in user mode with low priority
  • System : time spent in system mode
  • Idle : idle task time
  • IO Wait : time waiting for I/O to complete
  • IRQ : time servicing interrupts
  • Soft IRQ : time servicing soft IRQs
  • Context switches : cumulative context switches

    Author:
    darts
    See Also:

    prevVals

    private long[] prevVals
    Previous values (jiffy counts) of metrics. Used to determine difference in sum over fixed time. 
     0 - total      : total processing time
 1 - user       : time spent in user mode
 2 - nice       : time spent in user mode with low priority
 3 - system     : time spent in system mode
 4 - idle       : idle task time
 5 - iowait     : time waiting for I/O to complete
 6 - irq        : time servicing interrupts
 7 - softirq    : time servicing softirqs
 8 - context switches
 (8) steal      : time spent in other OS when running virtualized environment
 (9) guest      : time spent running virtual CPU for guest OS
